There is no creator, no receiver, not hearing from others, and universally illuminating enlightenment.
Naturally endowed with the power of fearlessness, practicing the wondrous pure conduct boundless,
With boundless wisdom and understanding like wandering in the sky, I wish the great Dharma King to proclaim the wondrous Dharma.
At that time the World-Honored One had this thought:

The wholesome roots of these five hundred elders are already ripe and they are fit for the Dharma. I will now speak the Dharma as appropriate for them, enabling the elders to immediately abandon their secular appearances here, leave the household life with faith, cut off all afflictions, and attain the wisdom of ending defilements.
Having had this thought, he ascended into the sky and sat cross-legged.
The elders, having witnessed the spiritual transformation, marveled at the unprecedented event, and their respect and faith in the Tathagata doubled.
At that time the World-Honored One said to the elders:
You should listen well.

There are ten kinds of oppressive suffering in the world, namely: the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of sorrow, the suffering of resentment, the suffering of painful feelings, the suffering of mental anguish, and the suffering of the pain and distress of birth and death. These ten kinds of oppressive suffering oppress sentient beings.
Do you now wish to be liberated from them?
Furthermore, elders!

There are ten kinds of harmful things in the world, namely: having done harm to my body in the past, doing harm to my body now, and doing harm to my body in the future; having done harm to those I have loved in the past, doing harm to those I love now, and doing harm to those I will love in the future; having benefited those I have not loved in the past, benefiting those I do not love now, and benefiting those I will not love in the future. Moreover, one's mind is harmed by all harmful offenses.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of harmful things?
Furthermore, all of you elders,

there are ten kinds of heterodox views and dense forests of evil views in the world, namely the view of self, the view of sentient beings, the view of life, the view of a person, the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, the view of no function, the view of no cause, the view of inequality, and the view of wrong views.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of dense forests of evil views?
Furthermore, elders,

the world is struck by ten kinds of great poisonous arrows, namely the poison of craving, the poison of ignorance, the poison of desire, the poison of greed, the poison of faults, the poison of stupidity, the poison of arrogance, the poison of views, the poison of existence, and the poison of non-existence.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of great poisonous arrows?
Furthermore, all of you elders,

There are ten fundamental dharmas of craving in the world, namely, because of craving one seeks, because of seeking one obtains, because of obtaining one gives rise to possessiveness, because of possessiveness one gives rise to various attachments, because of various attachments one gives rise to desire and greed, because of desire and greed one gives rise to deep attachment, because of deep attachment one gives rise to stinginess, because of stinginess one accumulates, because of accumulation one guards and protects, because of guarding and protecting one holds onto swords and staves, slanders and disputes, and gives rise to various kinds of suffering and unwholesome dharmas.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten fundamental dharmas of craving?
Furthermore, elders!

There are ten kinds of wrong natures in the world, namely, wrong views, wrong thoughts, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong concentration, wrong liberation, and wrong knowledge and insight of liberation.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of wrong natures?
Furthermore, elders,

there are ten kinds of unwholesome courses of action in the world, namely killing, taking what is not given, engaging in sexual misconduct, false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, greed, malice, and wrong views.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of unwholesome courses of action?
Furthermore, elders,

there are ten kinds of defiled and tainted dharmas in the world, namely the taint of stinginess, the taint of evil precepts, the taint of anger, the taint of laziness, the taint of distraction, the taint of evil wisdom, the taint of not respecting the teachings of the elders, the taint of doubt, the taint of lack of faith and understanding, and the taint of lack of reverence.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten kinds of defiled and tainted dharmas?
Furthermore, elders,

There are ten kinds of great fears of birth and death in the world, namely: the net of stinginess and jealousy, the membrane of ignorance that covers and obscures, falling into the deep pit of foolishness, drowning in the swift current of desire, being struck by the poisoned arrow of wrong views, being scorched by the dense smoke of anger and resentment, being burned by the raging fire of greed and desire, being confused by the poisonous medicine of faults, being obstructed by the poisonous thorns of the hindrances, and being starved by the wilderness of transmigration.
Do you now wish to be liberated from these ten great fears of birth and death?
Then the five hundred elders spoke to the Buddha with a single mind and the same voice, saying:
World-Honored One!

We now wish to be liberated from the ten kinds of oppressive sufferings that you have spoken of, namely: birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, resentment, worry, suffering, harm, and the cycle of birth and death. We will extensively explain up to being liberated from the oppressive matters of transmigration and starvation in the wilderness. We will all wish to be liberated.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the five hundred elders:
You should listen well, I will now explain the essentials of the true Dharma.
Elders!
The eye does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because the eye has no action and no function, it cannot think or discriminate, therefore, elders, the eye is not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
In this way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, the mind does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because the mind has no action and no function, it cannot think or discriminate, therefore, elders,
the mind is also not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Furthermore, elders!
Form does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because form has no action and no function, it cannot think or discriminate, therefore, elders, form is also not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Thus, sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas do not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because dharmas are without action and without function, dharmas cannot think and cannot discriminate.
Therefore, elders,
dharmas are also not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Furthermore, elders,
the form aggregate does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because the form aggregate is without action and without function, the form aggregate cannot think and cannot discriminate, therefore, elders,
the form aggregate is not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Thus, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate, the consciousness aggregate does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because the consciousness aggregate is without action and without function, the consciousness aggregate cannot think and cannot discriminate, therefore, elders,
the consciousness aggregate is not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Furthermore, elders,
the earth element does not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
The earth element is inactive and without function, therefore the earth element cannot think or discriminate. Therefore, elders, the earth element is not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Thus, the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element do not seek liberation.
Why is it so?
Because the consciousness element is inactive and without function,
the consciousness element cannot think or discriminate.
Therefore, elders,
the consciousness element is not the self.
You should uphold it like this.
Furthermore, elders,
all phenomena are unreal, arising from discrimination, dependent on various conditions, without ability and power, and turning according to various conditions.
If there are various conditions, then phenomena are provisionally established; if there are no various conditions, then there are no provisional phenomena.
Elders,

All dharmas are only provisionally established. In this, there is no one who is born, ages, dies, exhausts, or arises. There is only the eternal severing of the destinies, purity, and quiescence that can be relied upon. Therefore, you should understand in this way.
Therefore, all elders!
All dharmas arise from unreal discrimination. They rely on many conditions, are weak and powerless, and turn according to many conditions.
If there are many conditions, provisionally established dharmas arise. If there are no many conditions, then there are no provisionally established dharmas.
All elders!

All dharmas are only provisionally established. In this, there is no one who is born, ages, dies, exhausts, or arises. There is only the eternal severing of the destinies, purity, and quiescence that can be relied upon.
Thus, all elders!

If there is unreal discrimination, then there is the provisional establishment of incorrect thought. If there is no unreal discrimination, then there is no provisional establishment of incorrect thought.
If there is incorrect attention, then ignorance is provisionally established; if there is no incorrect attention, then ignorance is not provisionally established.
If there is ignorance, then formations are provisionally established; if there is no ignorance, then formations are not provisionally established.
If there are formations, then consciousness is provisionally established; if there are no formations, then consciousness is not provisionally established.
If there is consciousness, then name-and-form is provisionally established; if there is no consciousness, then name-and-form is not provisionally established.
If there is name-and-form, then the six sense bases are provisionally established; if there is no name-and-form, then the six sense bases are not provisionally established.

If there are the six sense bases, then contact is provisionally established; if there are not the six sense bases, then contact is not provisionally established.ğŸ”½If there is contact, then feeling is provisionally established; if there is no contact, then feeling is not provisionally established.
If there is feeling, then craving is provisionally established; if there is no feeling, then craving is not provisionally established.
If there is craving, then there is the designation of grasping. If there is no craving, then there is no designation of grasping.
If there is grasping, then there is the designation of becoming. If there is no grasping, then there is no designation of becoming.
If there is becoming, then there is the designation of birth. If there is no becoming, then there is no designation of birth.
If there is birth, then there is the designation of old age and death. If there is no birth, then there is no designation of old age and death.
Thus, elders!
What is old age?

It is called the confusion of the mind and consciousness, the whitening and falling out of hair, the sagging and wrinkling of skin, the diminishing of lifespan, the decay of the faculties, and the deterioration of all conditioned things. This is called old age.
What is death?
It is called the loss and change of life, the cessation and falling away, the disintegration of the aggregates, the abandonment of the body, and the separation from the group. This is called death.
Old age and death together are called old age and death.
Elders!
If birth exists, then old age and death are provisionally established.
If birth does not exist, then old age and death are not provisionally established.
What is birth?
It is called birth, arising, entering, arising, the appearance of the aggregates, and obtaining the various realms and the same destiny of the assembly. This is called birth.
Elders!
If existence exists, then birth is provisionally established. If existence does not exist, then birth is not provisionally established.
What is existence?
It is called existence in desire, existence in form, and existence in the formless, as well as meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable karma, etc. This is called existence.
Elders!
If grasping exists, then existence is provisionally established. If grasping does not exist, then existence is not provisionally established.
What is grasping?
It is called grasping of desire, grasping of views, grasping of precepts and observances, and grasping of self, and is therefore called grasping.
Elders!
If craving exists, then grasping is provisionally established. If craving does not exist, then grasping is not provisionally established.
What is craving?
Namely, craving for form, craving for sound, craving for smell, craving for taste, craving for touch, and craving for dharmas. This is called craving.
Elders!
If feeling exists, then craving arises; if feeling does not exist, then craving does not arise.
What is feeling?
It is feeling born from eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact. This is called feeling.
Elders!
If contact exists, then feeling arises; if contact does not exist, then feeling does not arise.
What is contact?
It is eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact. This is called contact.
Elders!
If the six sense bases exist, then contact arises; if the six sense bases do not exist, then contact does not arise.
What are the six sense bases?
They are the eye sense base, ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, and mind sense base. These are the six sense bases.
Elders!
If name-and-form exists, there is the designation of the six sense bases; if name-and-form does not exist, there is no designation of the six sense bases.
What is name-and-form?
Name refers to feeling, perception, volition, contact, and attention, as well as the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements. This is called name.
Elders!
If consciousness exists, there is the designation of name-and-form; if consciousness does not exist, there is no designation of name-and-form.
What is consciousness? It refers to eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, and mind-consciousness. This is called consciousness.
Elders!
If there are volitional formations, there is the designation of consciousness; if there are no volitional formations, there is no designation of consciousness.
What are volitional formations?
It refers to thoughts about form, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, and mental phenomena. This is called volitional formations.
Elders!
If there is ignorance, there are volitional formations; if there is no ignorance, there are no volitional formations.
What is ignorance?

Namely, ignorance of the past, ignorance of the future, ignorance of the past and future, ignorance of the internal, ignorance of the external, ignorance of the internal and external, ignorance of suffering, ignorance of the cause, ignorance of cessation, ignorance of the path, ignorance of conditions, and ignorance of dependent origination.

Regarding conditioned phenomena, whether black or white, with conditions or without conditions, with light and shadow or without light and shadow, with faults or without faults, approachable or unapproachable, one lacks knowledge and insight, lacks confrontation and observation, and lacks thorough understanding. Such characteristics are called ignorance.
Elders!
If there is incorrect mental activity, then ignorance can be provisionally established. If there is no incorrect mental activity, then ignorance cannot be provisionally established.
What is called incorrect mental activity?
It refers to thinking, 'What kind of nature did I have in the past?ğŸ”½What kind of place was I in?
What kind of class was I in?ğŸ”½Where will I go in the future? What kind of nature will I have?
What kind of place will I be in?
What kind of things are they?
Moreover, one gives rise to many doubts within one's own body, thinking, What is called 'self'?
Who is this self?
Does it exist or not?
Is it empty or real?
What kind of nature does it have?
What kind of place is it?
What kind of kind is it?

In what place did I dwell in the past? In that place, I gave rise to such improper thoughts. From the six views, I gave rise to one view, grasping the view of self-existence, grasping the view of self-nonexistence, or relying on self to observe the view of self, or not relying on self to observe the view of self.
Moreover, one falsely gives rise to such a view, thinking, The self is the world, or it arises from conditions.
Is it permanent, constant, unchanging, and eternally abiding?
Such views are called improper thoughts.
Elders!
If there is false discrimination, then there is the establishment of improper thoughts. If there is no false discrimination, then there is no establishment of improper thoughts.
What is called unreal discrimination?
It refers to self, sentient beings, life, humans, individuals, the born, the mind-born, young brahmins, the doer, and the experiencer. This is called unreal.

However, ignorant ordinary beings falsely give rise to discriminations such as I, sentient beings, life, humans, individuals, the born, the mind-born, young brahmins, the doer, and the experiencer. This is called unreal discrimination.
Elders!
If there is unreal discrimination, then there is the false establishment of incorrect attention. If there is no unreal discrimination, then there is no false establishment of incorrect attention.
Elders!
If there is incorrect attention, then there is the false establishment of ignorance. If there is no incorrect attention, then there is no false establishment of ignorance.
If ignorance exists, then the establishment of formations is made. If ignorance does not exist, then the establishment of formations is not made.
Thus, up to if birth exists, then the establishment of old age and death is made. If birth does not exist, then the establishment of old age and death is not made.
At that time, the Buddha told the elders:
You should now know that all dharmas arise from unreal discrimination, relying on various conditions, weak and powerless, turning with various conditions.
If various conditions exist, then provisional dharmas exist. If various conditions do not exist, then provisional dharmas do not exist.
Elders!

All dharmas are only provisionally established. In this, there is no one who is born, no one who ages, no one who dies, no one who ends, and no one who arises. There is only the eternal severing of all destinies, purity, and nirvana that can be taken as refuge.
Elders!
What do you think?
For example, the various fish and water creatures born in a large pond, relying on what power do they abide?
The elders said:
World-Honored One!
These fish and so forth rely on the power of water to live.
The Buddha said:
It is just as you have said.
Elders!
Is there any thought in this water that has power?
The elders said:
World-Honored One!
This water has no power and no ability, what is there to think about?
The Buddha said:
It is just as you have said.
Elders!
The dharmas that arise from unreal discrimination are also like this, they are only provisionally established, powerless and unable, turning from various conditions.
If the various conditions exist, then there are provisional dharmas, if the various conditions do not exist, then there are no provisional dharmas.
Elders!

All dharmas are only provisionally established, in this there is no birth, no old age, no death, no exhaustion, no arising, only the eternal severing of the various destinies, purity, and nirvana that can be relied upon.
Therefore, elders!
You should properly contemplate that such a multitude of conditions are an unstable place, difficult to maintain, and deeply fearful, fleeing far away to avoid them.
You should also contemplate what dharma is this?
Because of fear of what dharma did you come here?
When you properly contemplate in this way, there is no dharma to be attained, no fear, and no abandonment.
Why is this?
All dharmas are unattainable, because they cannot be attained in any way;
All dharmas are without self, because they are free from defilements;
All dharmas are without sentient beings, because they are far removed from self;
All dharmas are without life, because they transcend birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, suffering, and distress;
All dharmas are without a grasper, because they are cut off from the three times;
All dharmas are without words, because all sounds cannot be spoken;
All dharmas are without attachment, because they have no object;ğŸ”½All dharmas are tranquil, because they have the characteristic of quiescence;
All dharmas are all-pervading, because they have the nature of space;
The nature of all dharmas is empty, because they have no fixed belonging;
All dharmas are unmoving, because they have no basis;
All dharmas abide in the ultimate reality, abiding well, because they are associated with the mark of immovability;
All dharmas cannot be revealed, because they are free from the waves of characteristics;
All dharmas cannot be shown, because they are without characteristics, without form, without light or shadow, and free from all activities;
All dharmas do not belong to the self, because they are free from the notion of mine;
All dharmas cannot be discriminated, because they are free from mind, thought, and cognition;
All dharmas have no store of craving, because they transcend the path of eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind;
All dharmas cannot be lifted or moved, because they are free from arising, abiding, and perishing;
All dharmas are without action and function, because they are free from mind, thought, and cognition;
All dharmas belong to conditions, because their nature is weak.
Elders!

I say this eye is composed of the four great elements, impermanent, not abiding, not constant, not solid, weak, quickly decaying, difficult to preserve, a collection of much suffering, with much disease and much harm.
You elders!
The eye is like this, one should not rely on it.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are also like this, one should not rely on them.
One should contemplate like this.
Furthermore, elders!
The eye is like foam, not to be grasped, the eye is like a floating bubble, not able to last long, the eye is like
a mirage, born from the delusion of karma and love, the eye is like a plantain tree, with an unstable nature, the eye is like an illusion
arising from delusion, this eye is like a dream, only seen in falsehood, this eye is like an echo, bound to
many conditions, the eye is like a shadow, manifested by the light of karma, the eye is like floating clouds, gathering and scattering in disarray
, the eye is like a flowing lightning bolt, perishing in an instant, this eye has no owner, just like the earth, this eye
The eye is without self, like water. The eye is not a sentient being, like fire. The eye is not a life-force, like wind.
The eye is without self, like water; the eye is not a sentient being, like fire; the eye is not life, like wind; the eye is not a person, like space; the eye is unreal, relying on the great elements;
this eye is empty, apart from self and what belongs to self; this eye is without cognition, like grass, trees, earth, and stones; this eye
is without action, like a machine moved by wind; this eye is false, a gathering of decaying impurities; this eye is deceptive,
crushing, scattering, breaking, and perishing; the eye is like a pit, always oppressed by old age; the eye has
no abiding, and in the end returns to destruction.
Elders!
The eye has many faults, one should contemplate in this way, and so on up to the mind, and all dharmas are also like this.
Furthermore, elders!
All dharmas only have false desires. Foolish ordinary beings do not know false desires, and therefore falsely call it the eye, falsely call it the ear, and so on up to falsely calling it the mind.

Venerable Ones, there is only false desire. Because foolish ordinary beings do not understand false desire, they say this is form, they say this is sound, and the same is so for smell, taste, and touch.
Venerable Ones,

there is only false desire. Because foolish ordinary beings do not understand false desire, they say this is the form aggregate, they say this is the feeling aggregate, and the same is so for the aggregates of perception, mental formations, and consciousness.
Venerable Ones,

there is only false desire. Because foolish ordinary beings do not understand false desire, they say this is the earth element, they say this is the water element, and the same is so for the elements of fire, wind, space, and consciousness.
Venerable Ones,
all dharmas have only false desire. Because foolish ordinary beings do not understand false desire, they say this is conditioned, they say this is unconditioned, and the same is so for all dharmas.
Venerable Ones,
You should now abandon false desires and pursue the absence of desires. Deeply understand the falsity of your wives, children, home, and wealth, and do not cling to them.
By not clinging, with pure faith you will abandon the practices of the household life and enter the homeless life, and you will attain the absence of desires.
Elders!
What is called the absence of desires of leaving the household life?

It means abiding in the precepts, the liberation of the precepts, fully upholding dignified conduct, seeing even minor offenses as greatly frightening, accepting and studying the precepts, and perfecting the aggregate of morality.
Elders!

If you are able to uphold the precepts, then regarding these six sense faculties, six sense objects, five aggregates, and six elements, deeply understand their falsity and do not cling to them. Because of non-attachment, this is called the Dharma of the absence of desires of leaving the household life.
Elders!
If you do not cling to the eye and even to the realm of consciousness, because of non-attachment you will not protect.
What is not protecting?

The eyes do not protect, the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind do not protect, forms do not protect, sounds, smells, tastes, tactile objects, and dharmas do not protect, the form aggregate does not protect, the feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness aggregates do not protect, the earth element does not protect, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements do not protect.
Because of not protecting, there are no afflictions. If there are no afflictions, it is called light.
What is meant by light?
It means not seeing anything.

If one does not see anything, then one does not give rise to an angry and harmful mind based on objects. Because of being without anger and harm, one does not harm oneself, does not think of harming others, and does not think of harming both. Because of being without harm, one then enters and realizes the realm of great nirvÄá¹‡a without remainder.
Elders!
You should know who enters and realizes quiescence.
Elders!

The eye does not enter into quiescence, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind do not enter into quiescence, yet based on the eye one gives rise to various false attachments, either conceiving of it as a self or conceiving of it as belonging to a self. If one is able to be far removed from this, then it is quiescence.
What is it that one is far removed from that is quiescence?

If one is far removed from greed, then that is quiescence. If one is far removed from hatred, then that is quiescence. If one is far removed from delusion, then that is quiescence. If one is free from ignorance, then that is quiescence.
Furthermore, elders!
Past ignorance cannot be far removed, future ignorance cannot be far removed, present ignorance cannot be far removed;
Yet one must rely on being far removed from ignorance in order for right knowledge to arise.
Elders!
What is knowledge?
It is called the knowledge of exhaustion.
What is the knowledge of exhaustion?
The past is not the knowledge of exhaustion, the future is not the knowledge of exhaustion, the present is not the knowledge of exhaustion.
Yet, elders!
It is because of being far removed from ignorance that this knowledge arises.
This wisdom is not separate from wisdom. It arises due to the separation from the eye and the absence of wisdom.
Moreover, householders!

The eye is not one's own. If it is not one's own, then one does not grasp or cling to it. If one does not grasp or cling to it, then that is the supreme. If it is the supreme, then that is liberation.
Where is liberation?
One attains liberation from the grasping of self.

One attains liberation from the grasping of sentient beings, the grasping of life, the grasping of an individual, the grasping of annihilation and permanence, the grasping of everything, up to the grasping of discrimination.
If a practitioner is able to be liberated from grasping, then he does not discriminate. If he does not discriminate, then he is neither discriminating nor not discriminating.
What is not discriminating?
It refers to not discriminating the self and what belongs to the self.

At that time, the practitioner abandons and does not accumulate all dharmas, and abandons without grasping. Because of abandoning, he attains quiescence, liberation, and removal, the supreme liberation free from all bonds.
In what place is it called elimination?
In all places of suffering, it is attained through elimination.
You all, long-lived ones!
If seeking liberation, do not give rise to attachment to a single dharma.
Why is this?
If there is attachment, then there is fear; if there is no attachment, then there is no fear.
Furthermore, long-lived ones!
The eye is not quiescent, the ear nose tongue body mind are also not quiescent, form is not quiescent, up to the consciousness realm is also not quiescent.
However, long-lived ones!
Because of the consciousness realm, one gives rise to unreal grasping, either taking it as the self or as that which belongs to the self. If one departs from this, then it is quiescent.
What is it that is departed from, and quiescence is attained?
It is said that by departing from craving, quiescence is attained; by departing from hatred, departing from delusion, and departing from ignorance, quiescence is attained.
Furthermore, long-lived ones!
Past ignorance cannot be eliminated, future ignorance cannot be eliminated, and present ignorance cannot be eliminated;
Yet, by being apart from ignorance, the arising of wisdom is attained.
Elders!
What is wisdom?
It is called the wisdom of exhaustion.
What is the wisdom of exhaustion?
Past is not the wisdom of exhaustion, future is not the wisdom of exhaustion, and present is not the wisdom of exhaustion;
Yet, elders!
It is because of being apart from ignorance that wisdom is able to arise.
This wisdom is not apart from wisdom, because by being apart from the consciousness of ignorance, wisdom is able to arise.
And this realm of consciousness is not mine, if it is not mine, then I do not grasp at it, if I do not grasp at it, then that is the highest, if that is the highest, then that is liberation.
Where is liberation?
It is attained through liberation from the grasping at self, sentient beings, life, and up to all discriminations and graspings.
If practitioners can be liberated from grasping, then they will not discriminate. If they do not discriminate, then they are neither discriminating nor not discriminating.
What is non-discrimination?
It means not discriminating between self and what belongs to self.
At that time, practitioners abandon and do not accumulate, let go and do not grasp. Because of letting go, they attain quiescence, liberation, and removal, the supreme liberation free from all bonds.
What is removed?
All places of suffering are removed.
You elders!
If you seek liberation, do not grasp at any dharma.
Why is this?
If there is grasping, then there is fear. If there is no grasping, then there is no fear.
At that time, the World-Honored One, wanting to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
Grasping gives rise to fear, and from this one goes to evil paths.
Contemplating this fearful place, the wise should not grasp.
You should cultivate the noble path and observe well,
If you observe in this way, you will attain it; otherwise, it is impossible.
All places are empty, illusory movements are not solid,
Love deceives the world, do not be disturbed by this.
I have already known the empty dharmas, understood that all dharmas are not solid,
Tranquil and peaceful, attaining stability, realizing the wondrous bliss of non-movement.
If one understands in this way that all dharmas are only empty,ğŸ”½One will be liberated from all suffering and extinguish disputes,
In order to embrace all that gives rise to calamities and misfortunes.
Because of embracing, there is attachment; because of attachment, there is birth in various existences,
From existence, birth arises; because of birth, one is far from nirvana,
For the born there is old age, sickness, and death, such great suffering oppresses.
Because of no desire, there is no grasping; because of no grasping, there is no existence,
Because there is no existence, there is no birth, and the same is so for old age, sickness, and death.
